intro: Sorbus alnifolia f. tiliifolia, commonly known as the leafy whitebeam, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by small, round berries that ripen to a dark red or black color. It is often found in woodlands, hedgerows, and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. The foliage and fruit make it an attractive plant for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
